title: Jennifer Aniston braves the rain in strapless black dress for The Late Show With Stephen Colbert
text:
She's busy promoting her Apple TV+ original series The Morning Show.

And Jennifer Aniston didn't let the New York weather rain on her parade Tuesday.

The actress, 50, was spotted arriving at the Late Show With Stephen Colbert wearing a strapless black dress and paused to pose for photos outside the CBS studio as her publicist held an umbrella over her head.

It's wet: She's busy promoting Apple TV+'s The Morning Show. And Jennifer Aniston didn't let the New York weather rain on her parade as she headed to the Late Show With Stephen Colbert

Jen's frock was cinched at the waist and featured a fabric belt with silver clips, one of which held up an extra section of skirt for an on trend look.

She went bare-legged in black sandal heels and wore her shoulder-length blonde hair loose and tousled.

The former Friends star added statement pendant earrings and rocked black eye-liner and mascara, plenty of rosy blush and glossy lip color.

Stylish come what may: The actress, 50, was spotted arriving at the CBS studio Tuesday evening wearing a strapless black dress and black sandal heels

Had help: Jen smiled gamely as her publicist held an umbrella over her head to keep her dry

Ready for TV: The former Friends star wore her shoulder-length blonde hair loose and tousled and rocked black eye-liner and mascara, plenty of rosy blush and glossy lip color

Aniston stars in The Morning Show as a veteran TV anchor who is forced to work alongside an ambitious local reporter when her longtime co-host is accused of sexual misconduct.

The show co-stars Reese Witherspoon, who like Aniston is an executive producer, as well as Steve Carell and Billy Crudup.

The series was the first to be commissioned by Apple for its new streaming on demand platform and was given an initial order for two seasons.

Apple CEO Tim Cook joined Aniston and Witherspoon for a star-studded premiere in NYC on Monday night.

Promotion: The Morning Show was the first to be commissioned by Apple for its new streaming on demand platform and Apple CEO Tim Cook joined Aniston and co-star Reese Witherspoon for a star-studded premiere in NYC on Monday night

Drops Friday: Aniston stars in The Morning Show as a veteran TV anchor who is forced to work alongside an ambitious local reporter (Witherspoon) when her longtime co-host (Carell) is accused of sexual misconduct

The series cost $15 million per episode, which equates to a $300 million two-season total.

But early reviews from critics have been less than glowing.

The Morning Show registers scores of 60 and 71 percent on Metacritic and Rotten Tomatoes respectively.

And the best thing that Rolling Stone's Alan Sepinwall had to say about it was that it 'isn't terrible.'

'The series is a well-polished snore, a prime example of how throwing money at a problem — in this case, Apple's need to dive into the streaming wars ... — isn't inherently the best way to solve it,' Sepinwall wrote.

The Hollywood Reporter's Daniel Feinberg was also unimpressed, opining that the show struggled to find its focus in the first two episodes before becoming 'more satisfying' in the third.

IndieWire critic Ben Travers was blunt: 'All the pretty people in the world can't keep you hooked when the purpose is this muddled, and hoo boy, is it hard to figure out what The Morning Show wants to accomplish, or even who we're meant to care about.'

The first three episodes of The Morning Show drop on Friday with the launch of Apple TV+ which has a monthly subscription of $4.99.
description: Aniston, 50, is busy promoting her Apple TV+ original series The Morning Show.
